definition: to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook

sentences.english: Painting, writing on wall or machine and disturbing other work with concrete evidence.
sentences.chinese: 涂写墙壁机器，有碍观瞻，且具体事实者。

sentences.english: They result in severe cracking which is always ugly .
sentences.chinese: 这会导致构件严重开裂，开裂总会有碍观瞻。

sentences.english: The Polish market in Berlin was considered unsightly and shut down.
sentences.chinese: 柏林市内的波兰市场因为被认为有碍观瞻而关闭了。

sentences.english: It's bad enough that your elbows are dry and itchy, but they look terrible too.
sentences.chinese: 手肘干燥发痒已经够糟糕了，更重要的还有碍观瞻。

sentences.english: They result in severe cracking which is always ugly.
sentences.chinese: 这会导致构件严重开裂，开裂总会有碍观瞻。

sentences.english: It often stinks, attracts vermin and creates eye sores.
sentences.chinese: 它发出臭味，吸引害虫，有碍观瞻。

sentences.english: That garbage heap is an eyesore in such a beautiful scenic spot.
sentences.chinese: 在风景如此优美的地方有堆垃圾，真是有碍观瞻。

definition: to view/to look at/to look sth over
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to pay homage (at a monument, mausoleum etc)
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
to look far ahead/to look forward (to)
places of historic interest/historical sites/CL:個|个[ge4]
to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
to lean on sth and gaze into the distance
former appearance/what it used to look like
a place famous for its scenery or historical relics/scenic spot/CL:處|处[chu4]
